intro: Thesium intricatum, commonly known as the woolly thesium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, often appearing in late spring or early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and plant enthusiasts.
